name: E̸̢͆͝m̷̛̟͝b̸̮̭̂̅r̴̹̅a̶̭͔̍c̸̛̠̆ḛ̴͇̽̕ ̸̟́͊D̶̛͍̺a̴̡̱̒r̵̖̆͆ḵ̸͓̌n̵̦̐͝ë̴̮͊s̷͙̋̃s̶̱̥͒
description:
Quarentined Fractals .1

He didn't have any cuts
Not in visible places nor the non-visible ones
Didn't want to draw attention...
Never tried it, not even once
He knew, deep inside, that
If he wanted to do it, he'd just go ahead
Countless times was caught in the kitchen
Just staring at a blade
Never did anything though
Just thought about it
For the outsiders, he had just hit the perfect life
Sex, friends, money, family, fun, notoriety
Didn't bother to pull the trigger
Didn't bother to push the knife
Didn't bother to stop his heart
so then,
nothing.

But on that singular day he did bother.
A moment was all it took.
A snap of fingers and there he was, staring into the abyss once again
depression lurked into his mind, like it did thousands and thousands of times before.
But this time it was different.
He was outworn, weary. He just wanted to numb the pain.
The more he thought about it, the more certain he was.
fucking useless, annoying, unsatisfying leech!
fucking parasite!
as black marks started appearing at the corners of his eyes
he took a single step into the abyss
There was no blood, since there was nobody to see.
There was no sound of broken bones, not even a corpse to dispose.
"Why bother anyone with your remains?" He wondered, as he fell deeper and deeper into the void.
"I can already feel the pain being vanquished by my immortal soul"
He felt the tip of his fingers becoming torpid
He was still awake when his soul decided to leave
The initial adrenalin wore out
soon he'd hit the ground,
and then
nothing

But then, something pulled him back.
Picture his anger, his fury
this newborn madness was too much for the poor soul
and soon begun to consume what was left of his broken mind
his insubstantial body got filled with feelings he couldn't comprehend 
and because of that he suddenly stoped falling.
This anger was not directed to the rest of the world
it was directed for one. The one in the mirror.
The single sane piece of his own mind
who had pulled him back from the underlying abyss.
There was just so much madness, so much pain, for such a young boy
So the inner crisis finally reached the surface of his hollow flesh,
as his feet kicked the chair
as his feet stood there, dangling mid air
The heart started beating normally
As soon as the hallucinogens stopped infecting his brain
He woke up at some dude's house
With a syringe and a spoon, or maybe some aluminum paper
And then
nothing.
